text: John Stewart Wyllie, also known as Jock Wyllie (1884 – 1940) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a centre half. ==Career== Born in Riccarton, Wyllie spent his early career with Kilmarnock Deanpark, Kilmarnock, Rangers, Maxwelltown Volunteers, Ayr Parkhouse, Ayr, Hurlford, Clyde and Aberdeen. He signed for Bradford City from Aberdeen in May 1912.Frost, p. 410 He made 24 league appearances for the club,Frost, p. 390 before returning to Aberdeen in September 1913. He later played for Fraserburgh, St Johnstone and Forfar Athletic, and later coached in Norway. ==Sources== * ==References== Category:1884 births Category:1940 deaths Category:Date of birth uncertain Category:Date of death missing Category:Scottish footballers Category:Kilmarnock F.C. players Category:Sportspeople from Kilmarnock Category:Rangers F.C. players Category:Ayr Parkhouse F.C. players Category:Ayr F.C. players Category:Hurlford United F.C. players Category:Clyde F.C. players Category:Aberdeen F.C. players Category:Bradford City A.F.C. players Category:Fraserburgh F.C. players Category:St Johnstone F.C. players Category:Forfar Athletic F.C. players Category:Highland Football League players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:English Football League players Category:Association football defenders
title: John Wyllie (footballer)
